QUESTION6) In Singer’s understanding, the principle of the equality of human beings is
(A) a description of an alleged actual equality among humans.
(B) a description of an alleged equality among all living beings.
(C) a prescription of how we should treat nonhuman animals.
(D) a description of an alleged inequality among all living beings.
(E) a prescription of how we should treat humans.
(F) a description of an alleged actual inequality among humans.
(G) a description of an alleged actual superiority of humans over nonhuman animals.
(H) a prescription of how we should treat both human and nonhuman animals equally.
(I) a prescription of how we should treat nonhuman animals differently.
(J) a prescription of how we should treat the environment.

QUESTION8606) The cornea of the eye is a convex mirror, and the high-light usually seen in it is a reflected image. Suppose that a circular object 20 cm in diameter is located 40 cm from the eye. If the radius of the cornea is 0.8 cm, how far is the virtual image from the cornea and what is its size?
(A) 6 mm inside the cornea, 3 mm in diameter
(B) 3 mm inside the cornea, 1 mm in diameter
(C) 5 mm outside the cornea, 1.5 mm in diameter
(D) 4 mm outside the cornea, 2 mm in diameter
(E) 5 mm inside the cornea, 2 mm in diameter
(F) 5 mm inside the cornea, 2.5 mm in diameter
(G) 4 mm inside the cornea, 2 mm in diameter
(H) 8 mm inside the cornea, 2.5 mm in diameter
(I) 4 mm inside the cornea, 3 mm in diameter
(J) 2 mm outside the cornea, 2 mm in diameter

QUESTION8976) What is utility? What is marginal utility?
(A) Utility is the measure of usefulness or pleasure. Marginal utility is the decrease in usefulness or pleasure as more units are consumed.
(B) Utility is the quantity of a product. Marginal utility is the increase in quantity which a consumer gets from an additional unit of a specific good.
(C) Utility is the power to satisfy a want. Marginal utility is the extra utility, or satisfaction, which a consumer derives from an additional unit of a specific good.
(D) Utility is the duration of time a product can be used. Marginal utility is the increase in usage time with each additional unit consumed.
(E) Utility is the measure of scarcity of a good. Marginal utility is the change in scarcity when one more unit of the good is produced.
(F) Utility is the weight of a product. Marginal utility is the additional weight a consumer perceives when purchasing an extra unit of a specific good.
(G) Utility is the power to make a good. Marginal utility is the extra power which a consumer derives from an additional unit of a specific good.
(H) Utility is the total satisfaction received from consuming a certain amount of a good. Marginal utility is the satisfaction gained from the last unit consumed, holding the level of consumption constant.
(I) Utility is the price of a good. Marginal utility is the increase in price which a consumer pays for an additional unit of a specific good.
(J) Utility is the demand for a product. Marginal utility is the change in demand as the supply of a specific good increases.

QUESTION5103) The daily protein intake of a typical American diet consists of meat, dairy products and eggs. Its average net protein utilization (NPU) is 70. If the daily protein requirement of the body is 0.3 g per pound of body weight, what is the actual protein requirement for an average American?
(A) 100 g of protein per day
(B) 70 g of protein per day
(C) 64.5 g of protein per day
(D) 0.43 g of protein per day
(E) 35 g of protein per day
(F) 200 g of protein per day
(G) 80 g of protein per day
(H) 150 g of protein per day
(I) 120 g of protein per day
(J) 50 g of protein per day

QUESTION5749) An example of a categorical grant would be

(B) money loaned by the federal government to a state to prevent it from bankruptcy

(D) money loaned by the federal government to states for infrastructure projects
(E) money given by the federal government to states without conditions
(F) money loaned by the federal government to a private company to prevent it from failing
(G) money given by the federal government to cities with no specific use required

QUESTION5130) Which of the following statements about glucose metabolism is correct?

(B) Glycolysis doesn't require any enzymes
(C) In glycolysis, glucose is cleaved into two three-carbon products
(D) Glucose metabolism only occurs in the presence of oxygen
(E) In glycolysis, glucose is converted into two molecules of fructose
(F) Glycolysis requires ATP only
(G) Glucagon increases the rate of glycolysis
(H) Glycolysis requires NADP+

QUESTION11435) In binary number system the first digit (bit) from right to left is called as

(C) LSB, Least Significant Bit
(D) Last Bit
(E) Binary Digit
(F) Initial Bit
(G) Binary Significant Bit
(H) Bit Zero
(I) First Bit
